page.title: 10A Comprehensive School,Corby
page.content: A comprehensive school is a state run school teaching children of all abilities from 11 to 18 years and there are five in Corby. The schools no longer have corporal punishment, but you can be placed in detention after school and made to copy up your work. The majority of the teachers are easy- going but in some lessons are very strict and you are not allowed to speak at all. At the moment the teachers are on strike over their pay and we have missed several days of school. The main teaching union is the National Union of Teachers. Many of the school desks are defaced and squeak and the chairs are often bent or broken. There is little money for repairs or replacement. We have no compulsory uniform and can wear any clothes. At lunch the cafeteria serves food on a first come first served basis
